site_name: 3 Avebury ParkLovelace GardensSurbitonKT6 6SQ
description: Use of flat roof as roof terrace (retrospectively) and proposed erection of 1.7m high obscured glazed screening
decision_conditions: The proposed development would by virtue of its siting and scale, create an incongruous addition to the host property that would be visually intrusive and detract from the character and appearance of the host property and the surrounding area. The proposal would not accord with policies CS8 and DM10 of the Council's adopted LDF Core Strategy April 2012.

The proposed terrace and the privacy screens, by reason of its scale and siting would be unneighbourly and would appear overbearing when viewed from the adjoining properties, resulting in unacceptable living conditions for the occupants of these properties. The proposal is therefore contrary to Policy 7.6 of the London Plan 2016 and Policies CS8 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

In dealing with the application the Council has implemented the requirement in the National Planning Policy Framework to work with the applicant in a positive and proactive way.  We have made available detailed advice in the form or our statutory policies in the Core Strategy, Supplementary Planning Documents, Planning Briefs and other informal written guidance, as well as offering a full pre-application advice service, in order to ensure that the applicant has been given every opportunity to submit an application which is likely to be considered favourably.
